    Team News

    Juventus
    • Juventus have no fresh injury concerns and Max Allegri can place his strongest available side in the Champions League final against Real Madrid.
    • Allegri has the luxury of being able to play a 4-2-3-1 or 3-4-2-1 formation and that will keep Madrid on their toes up until kick off.
    Real Madrid
    • Gareth Bale has been declared fit to play in the Champions League final but that gives Zinedine Zidane a major problem. Isco has arguably been Real Madrid's best player this season but he would be the one forced to drop out of the team at Bale's expense.
    • It would be a huge call from Zidane to leave the club's most expensive ever player out of the starting XI but you'd have to say it would be justified based on how Madrid have played without Bale for most of the season.
    • Daniel Carvajal has also been included in the squad and has a more realistic chance to start if fit, providing Madrid with a huge boost.

    Prediction

    • Real Madrid are bidding to become the first side in the history of the Champions League to retain the trophy and the first defending champions to have the chance of achieving the feat since Manchester United in 2009.
    • Juventus, however, are looking to spoiil the party. The Italians have only conceded three goals all season in the competition and are aiming to win the Champions League for the first time since 1996. They have lost a Champions League final six times in the past, more than any other side.
    • This final is evenly poised and could go either way. Can Buffon finally win the Champions League? Or will Cristiano Ronaldo's Real Madrid continue to make history? Extra-time and penalties may be the only way to decide the outcome of this final.
    Prediction:
    Juventus
    1
    1
    Real Madrid
